summary: Conrad E. Baetz was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He is listed in several payroll and certification reports from 1977 and 1978. These documents detail his position and salary within the committee. The documents span from October 1977 to November 1978, indicating his employment during that period. The consistent appearance of his name across multiple payroll certifications suggests he was a regular staff member during the HSCA's investigation.
significance: Conrad E. Baetz's significance lies in his role as a staff member of the HSCA. While the specific nature of his work is not detailed in these documents, his presence on payroll and certification reports indicates his involvement in the committee's operations during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
